Search Popular Searches Fastrack Rides & Attractions Map Contact Us Contact Us Toggle Navigation Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive Contact Us Customer Services Local Residents Lost Property SignLive We're here to help Our friendly and knowledgeable team at Thorpe Park would love to answer your questions regarding any aspect of your trip. We are on hand to deal with any ticket enquiry or to help you plan your day and answer any questions that you may have prior to your thrilling visit to Thorpe Park. You can contact us in any of the below ways: Visit the help centre Check out the FAQ pages where answers to most questions can be found. Check out our Help Centre first before contacting us - it's the best place to get the help you need! Help Centre Amending Your Booking Use your booking portal which allows you to amend the dates of your tickets without contacting us. If you still need support in changing your ticket date, get in contact with our team and we can support you. Booking Portal Live Chat Thorpe Park's Digital Assistant is on hand to help you with any enquiries. Our agents are online daily from 9:30am - 4:30pm, or until half an hour before the park closes should you require further assistance. Outside of these hours, you will only be able to contact the Thorpe Bot. To start a chat, click the blue chat icon in the bottom right corner of the page Guest Enquiries If you need to send us and email with a question, you can use our enquiry form. Please remember to check our FAQs first as this is often the faster way to find out the information you need. Average Response Time: 3 Days Contact Form Telephone You can contact our call centre team on 01932 577131 Our agents are on hand to answer your call from 09:30am  - 16:00pm Monday to Friday. We can still be reached via Live Chat or email, for any assistance you may need outside of these times. Want to talk about something specific? Our dedicated teams are also available to help you with the below areas: Guest Feedback We understand the importance of guest feedback and we are keen to hear about your experience. We rely on guests reporting their experience to us to ensure we are always under continuous improvement. Average Response Time: 3 days Contact Customer Services Lost Property If you have a lost item whilst at the park, you can raise a claim with our friends at Boomerang. Visit our Lost Property page for more information and next steps on how to report your missing items(s). Lost Property School Bookings You can visit our dedicated Schools page for all information on organising a school trip with us, prices & planning, resources, and more. Find out more Overnight Stays If you have a query about your overnight stay, check out our Frequently Asked Questions. For anything that can't be answered here, please contact our team on shark.hotel@thorpe-park.co.uk Overnight Stays FAQs VIP Experiences To discuss a new or existing VIP package please email the VIP team on vip@thorpe-park.co.uk Email VIP Experiences Corporate Events To enquire or to book a corporate event, please contact our events team on events@thorpe-park.co.uk Email Corporate Events Charity Requests Here at Thorpe Park, we support Merlin's Magic Wand, which is a global children's charity that supports children facing challenges of serious illness, disability or adversity. For more information please see Merlin's Magic Wand . We often support charities and schools within the immediate locality of the park. Due to numerous requests, only registered charities and schools based within the local vicinity of the park will be considered. Please email all requests through to charity.requests@thorpe-park.co.uk . Please note that we are unable to accept or respond to letter requests unless an email address is given. As we receive many requests each day, we cannot respond to them all. If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks, then we regret to inform you that your request has been unsuccessful. Claims Notification Enquiries The UK Employers Liability Insurance Policy and the Global Public Liability Insurance Policy are both held with Chubb European Group Limited under Policy Number UKCANC33447. Claims are administered by Mclarens and should be submitted via the claims portal. The portal ID is D00029. If you do not have access to the claims portal, claims should be submitted to merlin.tpa@mclarens.com SignLive Contact us using British Sign Language (BSL) For more information click here Sign up to our Newsletter here! Sign up to receive our thrilling email newsletters... and get great offers and discounts! Current PHP version: 7.4.33.11 Rental & Sales Staff Ocean Properties Sales Staff Ocean Properties & Management, Inc. has a back office support staff that is available to assist our real estate associates with various different procedures. They are available to offer support regarding listing presentations, completion of contractual documents, contract negotiations, creation of colored property brochures, and company policies & procedures. Ocean Properties Vacation Rental Staff Our rental staff consists of the finest vacation rental industry professionals in the area.  Each is a valuable asset to our team and an integral part of our day-to-day operations. Toni Roe, the owner and co-founder since 1986, boasts over 40 years of profound expertise in vacation rental management. Her extensive experience has been the guiding force behind Ocean Properties Vacation Rentals, Inc., propelling it to the forefront as the industry leader in managing vacation rentals in the New Smyrna Beach area. Toni’s visionary leadership and unparalleled understanding of the industry have shaped our company’s legacy, setting the standard for excellence in vacation rental management. Margy Roe, the youngest daughter of Bill and Toni Roe, is the driving force behind the operations of our vacation rental company. With over two decades of industry experience, she carefully manages critical areas of the company such as business development, sales, and marketing,  and plays a vital role in our efforts to optimize property revenue through effective revenue management strategies.  She works closely with our team to maintain Ocean Properties Vacation Rentals, Inc.’s reputation for top-notch service, ensuring that every guest and owner feels like family. Margy carries forward the legacy her parents built, infusing it with her own dedication and expertise, ensuring the ongoing success of our company’s operations.  Margy holds her Vacation Rental Management Certification, a Professional Residential Manager (PRM) designation, and is a licensed real estate agent. Carole Swan, our Rental Manager, brings over 30 years of extensive experience in customer service and property management to our vacation rental division. At the forefront of our day-to-day operations, Carole expertly manages owner relations and oversees crucial aspects including housekeeping, maintenance, home inspections, facilitating quotes and upgrades, and acting as the primary conduit for communicating property needs to homeowners. Her seasoned expertise ensures the seamless management of our properties, guaranteeing top-notch services for both guests and homeowners. Paula Ledbetter excels as our Oceanwalk Owner Relations Manager, entrusted with overseeing all matters concerning property owners within the Oceanwalk complex. Her comprehensive role spans crucial areas, from managing housekeeping and maintenance to conducting home inspections, facilitating quotes and upgrades, and serving as the main liaison for communicating property needs to homeowners. Paula’s expertise ensures a seamless and responsive approach to property management, guaranteeing the highest standards for homeowner satisfaction within the Oceanwalk community. Trisha Owens, our Property Services Manager, oversees and manages our housekeeping, maintenance, and inspection teams. With a keen eye for detail, Trisha ensures our properties are meticulously maintained, swiftly relaying vital information to the Maintenance and Housekeeping Departments. Her proactive role guarantees our managed properties are kept in exceptional condition, promptly addressing any issues or areas requiring updates or repairs. Trisha’s positive demeanor and meticulous approach significantly impact her coordination with staff, vendors, guests, and owners, ensuring thorough inspections and seamless operations.  Trisha currently holds her FL CAM License, a Vacation Rental Inspector Certification, and is also a Breezeway Certified Short-Term Rental Safety Inspector.   She plays an integral role in our team, ensuring the properties we manage consistently deliver memorable guest experiences. Greeting customers with a smile, Rental Agents, Debbie Hayden, Jane McCartha, and Mary Jo Todorovich are responsible for the day-to-day operations at the front desk. Friendly and knowledgeable, all are trained to book the perfect vacation rental for your next stay in New Smyrna Beach. With a combined 50+ years in the customer service industry, they are all valuable assets to the vacation rental team. George Mossbarger, our Vacation Rentals Third Party & Revenue Management Specialist, is an integral part of our vacation rental team.  His expertise in online traveling networks is essential in today’s travel industry.   He works closely with our online partners such as VRBO, Airbnb, and TripAdvisor.   George also works as part of the Revenue Management Team.  His vast knowledge of online networks coupled with his years of hospitality experience makes him an asset to our Revenue Management team.  His diverse knowledge and passion for all facets of the vacation rental industry make him a perfect fit for our team as he continues to help us expand our marketing arms. Devyn Thompson is a valued member of our marketing team, contributing her skills to various facets of our marketing efforts. From managing our social media presence to enhancing our website, capturing stunning photography, and crafting engaging print ads, she plays a pivotal role in elevating our brand. Devyn’s multifaceted contributions are instrumental in promoting our vacation rentals in New Smyrna Beach and showcasing the exceptional experiences we offer to our guests. Sabrina Daugherty is our accomplished Revenue Manager with significant expertise in the Vacation rental industry.  As a licensed Property Manager and seasoned Revenue Manager, she excels in strategic analysis, identifying opportunities for revenue growth within property guidelines. Her keen understanding of market trends ensures agile adjustments to strategies as the market evolves. In the dynamic vacation rental landscape, Sabrina and our team are dedicated to adapting and optimizing, ensuring the ongoing success of our properties. Josh Kruel, Patrick Borcherding, and Bruce Miller form the backbone of our maintenance team, ensuring the pristine condition of all our properties. Trained to meticulously inspect and uphold property standards, they guarantee our spaces are in top shape. Their responsibility extends beyond upkeep, providing timely assistance with maintenance needs during guest and owner stays. Their commitment to maintaining excellence ensures a seamless and enjoyable experience for both guests and owners throughout their stay. Sarah Frankhouser and Mary Luciano are integral members of our team, serving as Certified Vacation Rental Inspectors. Their roles are pivotal in ensuring that our properties meet the highest standards of cleanliness and maintenance for both owners and guests. Through their meticulous inspections, we ensure that every vacation rental in New Smyrna Beach is not only well-kept but also offers a pristine and enjoyable experience for all who stay with us.  Their dedication and expertise play a crucial part in upholding our commitment to excellence. Mike, Patrick, and Bruce, our dedicated in-house maintenance team, play a pivotal role in ensuring that your vacation rental property is impeccably maintained for both owners and guests. With their expertise and commitment to excellence, they assist with inspections and preventive maintenance tasks to keep every aspect of the property in top-notch condition. From routine checks to addressing any wear and tear promptly, their proactive approach guarantees a hassle-free experience for both owners and guests. Mike, Patrick, and Bruce take pride in creating a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere, making your property a standout choice for those seeking a memorable stay in the beautiful setting of New Smyrna Beach. Ocean Properties Long Term Rental Staff, ensuring that the properties that we manage offer memorable guest experiences. Please feel free to contact our rental staff at 1(800) 728-0513 or (386) 428-0513 Sherry Tarr , the Long Term Property Manager, has over 34 years of property management experience.  She is a licensed Real Estate Agent and has extensive knowledge of our local rental market.  She is an integral part of our Long Term Team and we are blessed to have her. Phone: (386) 428-0975 Extension 309 Barbara O’Hara , Long Term Bookkeeper – Barb manages all Long Term related payments and funds as well as leasing payment information for Long Term Owners. Phone: (386) 428-0975 Extension 367 Jasen Jandrew , our leasing agent, is a licensed real estate agent.  Jasen has an extensive background in sales and management.  He assists all tenant prospects with the application process and is able to find our owners the perfect tenants for their properties. Construction is anticipated to be completed in February 2024, and the park will open to the public in Spring 2024, weather permitting. A ceremonial dirt toss was conducted, which included the following individuals: St. Johns County Capital Improvement Project Program Manager Jason McKay St. Johns County Public Works Project Manager Phyllis Thorpe St. Johns County Parks and Recreation Assistant Director Jamie Baccari St. Johns County District 5 Commissioner Henry Dean Vilano Beach Main Street President Linda LaCerva St. Johns County Parks and Recreation Director Ryan Kane St. Johns County Assistant County Administrator Sarah Taylor St. Johns County Public Works Director Greg Caldwell The ceremony began with remarks from St. Johns County Parks and Recreation Assistant Director Jamie Baccari. “I’m so proud to be a part of an amazing team that, over the next few years, will present the community with several exciting park projects,” Baccari said. “I am particularly proud to announce this project because it began back in 2007. The County, with the help of a number of residents, purchased the old Fiddler’s Green restaurant through a Florida Communities Trust Grant for $5.5 million. The Parks team made minor improvements in 2008, but then, sadly, the original building sat vacant and had to be demolished in 2013. In 2019, the Board of County Commissioners funded the completion of this project by allocating $1.1 million toward the design and construction of the final phase of this park. In 2020, the board approved an additional $700,000 for the project to complete construction, giving a final budget of $1.8 million. This project would not have been possible without the continued support of our County Commissioners, especially Commissioner Henry Dean, and our County Administration, including Joy Andrews, Brad Bradley, Sarah Taylor, and Colin Groff.” “This property has a great history, but we’ve got a better future ahead,” Commissioner Dean said. “We should all share in this opportunity to celebrate what was and what will be.” The park will bring another much-needed outdoor space for recreation and building community to the county, including the following amenities: Improvements to the northern walkover to bring into ADA compliance. Renovation of existing restrooms. Construction of a covered performance stage with terraced seating. Construction of new outdoor showers. Construction of changing stations. Installation of a new climbing play structure and recreation features. Renovation of the existing south walkover. Addition of ADA parking in the existing parking lot. Matthews DCCM (formerly Matthews Design Group) and POND were the design consultants on the project, with E.B. Morris General Contractors, Inc. leading construction. St. Johns County will fund the renovation project’s $1,814,400 budget through Park Impact Fees and Tree Bank Fund. Home Government Departments Planning & Development Planning Division Short-Term Vacation Rentals Short-Term Vacation Rentals Florida Department of Business & Professional Regulation The Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulation's Recommended Safety Measures and Best practices for vacation rentals. Vacation rentals must adhere to Duval County safety measurements and guidelines. Guide to Vacation Rentals and Timeshare Projects Overview Short-term vacation rentals are privately owned dwelling units that are rented to guests more than three times in a calendar year for periods of less than 30 days or one calendar month, whichever is less, or which is advertised or held out to the public as a place regularly rented to guests as defined by Florida Statutes . Short-term vacation rentals are permitted in zoning districts where residential uses are permitted. Single-family, townhouses, and multi-family units being used as transient public lodging establishments are required to obtain a Short-Term Vacation Rental Certificate. Property's Zoning District Homestead Exemption In accordance with City ordinance, all existing short-term vacation rentals that require a certificate are required to make an application to the City of Jacksonville Beach. Applications can be submitted to the planning and development department at city hall, located at 11 3rd street north. An owner-occupied dwelling unit renting 50% or less of the unit is not subject to the short-term vacation rental regulations. Read more about the Homestead Exemption and how a short-term rental may affect your ability to qualify for the exemption. Renting your Homestead - Understanding the impact of renting your Homestead on exemptions Please contact TouristTax@coj.net for more information regarding Duval County vacation rental requirements. Obtain a Short-Term Vacation Rental Certificate If you are a property owner or a licensed agent for a property management company, you must apply for a short-term vacation rental certificate for every property being used as a short-term vacation rental. In order for your application to be processed, you must provide the following documentation with your application: Short-Term Vacation Rental Application , which includes a notarized affidavit Completed Local Business Tax Form for short-term vacation rentals Completed property inspection from the Fire Marshal prior to issuance of a Certificate (required for initial applications and modifications) Applicable application fee in the form of check only, made payable to the "City of Jacksonville Beach" You must also obtain and maintain the following state and county requirements: Duval County Local Business Tax Receipt Duval County Tourist Tax Certificate Registration Duval County Tourist Development Tax Guide Florida Department of Revenue Certificate Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulation (DBPR) License It is the owner's responsibility that ensure compliance with county and state rules and regulations. Short-Term Vacation Rental Unit Property Compliance Inspection An inspection of a short-term vacation rental unit is required prior to the initial issuance of and/or modifications to a Short-Term Vacation Rental Registration Certificate. In accordance with City ordinance, an inspection of the rental unit will be conducted by the Fire Marshal by appointment only. If violations are found, all violations must be corrected and the unit must be re-inspected prior to issuance of the registration certificate. The inspection shall be requested by the Responsible Party. Failure to provide the Fire Marshal access at the scheduled time will result in a "no show" fee of $100. Incomplete applications will not be accepted. The fee for initial and annual registration for each property is $150. The annual fee for a Local Business Tax Receipt is $79.20 for each property. The fees for County and State licenses and certificates can be found on their websites. All Short-Term Vacation Rental Registration Certificate holders must apply annually for a renewal of their Certificate by October 1st of each calendar year. Short-Term Vacation Rental Nuisance Complaints To report a potential code violation please submit an online request for service . For questions pertaining to short-term vacation rental certificates, please email us . Please allow 5 to 7 business days for a response. About us - OceanFront Services Underwater Services Natural Seabed ™ Engineering Services Mapping About us Employees News & Media Press contact Logo News The eSEA Policy Sustainability profile We stand for Projects Contact us Career Privacy Policy NO EN Underwater services Natural Seabed ™ Engineering services Mapping About us Projects The eSEA Policy Press Career A part of About us OceanFront is your preferred partner for underwater services and engineering solutions, covering everything from marine research to industrial operations and environmental conservation. We have a vision of leading in subsea and maritime operations and are deeply committed to providing sustainable and efficient solutions both on, in, and under the water. Our dedicated team works closely with customers to develop tailored solutions and think outside the box. We take pride in our work to serve the ocean and those who depend on it. At OceanFront, it’s all about integrity, sustainability, and innovation. Our commitment to challenging conventional practices and improving quality and efficiency is a part of our core identity. In addition to our versatile services, including underwater surveys and engineering services, we are also proud of our revolutionary approach to eco-friendly seabed cleanup through the concept of Natural Seabed. With the Natural Seabed concept, we work to restore the seabed to its natural state. Choose OceanFront as your partner to lead sustainable maritime operations on, in, and under the water. We are ready to meet your specific needs and goals, and we look forward to delivering results that contribute to a sustainable future for our oceans and future generations. Employees Aleksander Bøe Sandøy CEO +47 971 60 214 aleksander.sandoy@oceanfront.no Magnus Stranden Business Developer +47 920 84 126 magnus.stranden@oceanfront.no Mats Ulseth Ranheim CAD Trainee mats.ranheim@oceanfront.no Johan Kristiansen Project Manager +47 992 30 882 johan.kristiansen@oceanfront.no Benjamin Vartdal Marine Operator +47 960 44 495 benjamin.vartdal@oceanfront.no Geir Lervik IT Developer +47 995 68 845 geir.lervik@oceanfront.no Simon Bøe Farstad Admin Consultant +47 974 17 284 simon.farstad@oceanfront.no Our mission Innovative and significant player for sustainable and efficient operations on, in and underwater. Our promise We take new paths to solve challenges, serve the sea and those who use it. High integrity We must be true to our mission and vision. We must always show humanity and have an honest and fair demeanour. We must have firm, unwavering attitudes in line with the UN’s sustainability goals. Sustainable Our operation and execution/delivery must be in line with the UN’s sustainability goals and the measures it may entail. Innovative We will always seek to challenge established practices in all stages of operation and delivery to increase quality and efficiency. Address Kronullveien 1, 6521 Kristiansund Norway NO 917 082 669 Engagement Contact us Career News & Media Stay updated Facebook Instagram LinkedIn eSEA Group Natural Seabed ™ eSEA Advisory eSEA Group Developed by Mediehuset Bergen Contact us +47 971 60 214 aleksander.sandoy@oceangroup.no Menu Om oss OceanFront is a community builder that creates value for society and our business. We are in a green shift – a transformation. OceanFront is part of this shift. We are transparent, believe in what we do, and are proud of our contribution to meeting the UN’s Sustainability Goals. We have defined the following of the UN’s Sustainability Goals as crucial in our work. Our company is Eco-Lighthouse certified. This means that we have implemented concrete and profitable sustainability measures, which we believe will have great significance for the company’s competitiveness in the years ahead. We are a member of NOSCA Clean Ocean NOSCA Clean Oceans is an innovation cluster with 40 members from all over the country – industrial companies, entrepreneurs, premise givers and research and educational institutions. We work daily to create a world-leading arena for knowledge development, technology development and innovative solutions in the management of marine pollution – oil spills, undesirable effects of marine organisms (such as algae, seagrass, and jellyfish) and other marine waste (such as marine plastics). We focus on sustainability and emphasize innovation that covers the entire value chain – detection, classification, collection, and disposal. Nosca.no We will create a cleaner sea and specialize in retrieving man-made elements from the seabed using technology, innovative solutions, and experience from other marine and maritime industries. We do this without the use of people underwater to reduce both risk and costs in the operations. Our goal is to become the best and preferred player to remove unwanted elements and waste from the seabed. 94% of the waste in the sea sinks to the bottom. When we now have 5 floating continents of waste in the world’s oceans, it gives a picture of what is currently suffocating the seabed. By removing unwanted elements, we will recreate a natural seabed, which provides a better tomorrow for life in and by the sea. Such measures are crucial to achieve the goals of the Paris Agreement and contribute to the UN’s sustainability goal number 14. Our driving force is to preserve life underwater and take care of the ocean as the heart and lungs of the planet. High integrity We must be true to our mission and vision. We must always show humanity and have an honest and fair demeanour. We must have firm, unwavering attitudes in line with the UN’s sustainability goals. Sustainable Our operation and execution/delivery must be in line with the UN’s sustainability goals and the measures it may entail. Innovative We will always seek to challenge established practices in all stages of operation and delivery to increase quality and efficiency.
